content.description:
Important notice - changes to survey

The length of this questionnaire has been reduced in response to your feedback.

list: Data should relate to all sites in the UK. This includes England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.
We will treat your information securely and confidentially.

This survey is refreshed every two weeks. To avoid losing data and to help us provide real-time information please submit by the return by date, or at the latest before the next fortnightly survey goes live.
On average it takes 10 minutes to complete this survey once you have collected the information.
You can save a copy of your answers at the end of this questionnaire using the ‘Download as PDF’ button.

content.description: Please complete this survey even if you are a sole trader and it does not seem relevant to your business. All returns are important, as it allows decision-makers to understand how businesses of all sizes are performing in the current climate.
Thank you for participating in this important survey.
View the questions before you start the survey (this link opens in a new tab)
This survey has the following sections:
This section asks for general information on the business's trading status.
This section asks for information about your business's exporting activities and any related challenges.
This section asks for information about your business's importing activities and any related challenges.
This section asks for information about:

list: the availability of materials, goods and services within the EU
the availability of materials, goods and services within the UK
the main concern to your business

content.description: This section asks for information about:

list: price rises experienced by your business

content.description: This section asks for information about sending goods from GB to Northern Ireland and any related challenges.
Include
Goods sent to:
GB means ‘Great Britain’ which includes England, Scotland and Wales, but excludes Northern Ireland.
This section asks for information about your workforce such as:

The data from this survey is used widely to enable rapid response, and inform policy decisions about issues impacting UK businesses and the economy. This includes topics relating to business resilience, financial performance, trade and your workforce.
View the latest publication produced from this survey (this link opens in a new tab)

blocks.title: Trading status of your business
blocks.description: This section asks for general information on your business's trading status.

questions.title: Which of the following statements best describes {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s trading status?
questions.description:
You can interpret 'trading' as 'operating'.

Only select 'paused trading' if all trading or operations have temporarily stopped.

options.label: Currently partially trading
options.description: For example, trading with reduced hours or staff numbers

options.label: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks

options.label: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

values: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

questions.title: Where in the UK are your sites temporarily or permanently closed, if any?
questions.description:
You can interpret 'sites' as 'premises'.

Select all the regions where the majority of your business's sites are temporarily or permanently closed.

options.label: None of our sites are temporarily or permanently closed
options.value: None of our sites are temporarily or permanently closed

values: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

blocks.title: Exporting
blocks.description: This section asks for information about your business's exporting activities and any related challenges.

questions.title: Which of the following statements best describes {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s exporting status?

options.label: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export
options.value: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export

options.label: Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export
options.value: Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export

values: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export
Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export

questions.title: How did your business's exporting in March 2022 compare with March 2021?
Did your business experience any of the following challenges with exporting goods or services in March 2022?

options.label: Additional paperwork
options.description: For example, conformity assessments, customs declarations, health and rules-of-origin certifications

options.label: Basing some staff in an EU member state to be allowed to work
options.value: Basing some staff in an EU member state to be allowed to work

options.label: Change in transportation costs
options.description: For example, freight rates

options.label: Closure of infrastructure used to export goods or services
options.value: Closure of infrastructure used to export goods or services
options.description: For example, ports or shipping-container storage facilities

options.label: Customs duties or levies
options.description: Including VAT and other taxes

options.label: Destination countries changing their border restrictions
options.value: Destination countries changing their border restrictions

options.label: Finding information on how to export
options.value: Finding information on how to export

options.label: Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment
options.value: Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment
options.description: For example, containers, warehouse capacity or wooden pallets

options.label: Reduced demand for products and services
options.value: Reduced demand for products and services

options.label: Time taken for checks at the border
options.value: Time taken for checks at the border
options.description: For example, documentary or physical checks

options.label: Work permit or visa restrictions, or lack of mutual recognition of professional qualifications
options.value: Work permit or visa restrictions, or lack of mutual recognition of professional qualifications

options.label: Did not experience any challenges with exporting in March 2022
options.value: Did not experience any challenges with exporting in March 2022

values: Did not experience any challenges with exporting in March 2022

questions.title: What was the main cause of these exporting challenges?

options.label: End of the EU transition period
options.value: End of the EU transition period

options.label: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period
options.value: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period

questions.title: Does your business currently use rules of origin to access lower or zero tariffs on exports?

definitions.title: What we mean by 'rules of origin'

content.description: This is the criteria used to determine where a product was made. They exist in all Free Trade Agreements to ensure only goods made in countries that are part of the agreement can benefit from lower tariffs. You can view further information about rules of origin on the gov.uk website (this link opens in a new tab)

options.label: Yes, to both EU and non-EU countries
options.value: Yes, to both EU and non-EU countries

questions.title: How has using rules of origin when exporting to the EU changed the amount of administration for your business?

content.description: This is referring to gathering the information and completing the paperwork to prove goods comply with rules of origin.

questions.title: Why does your business not currently use rules of origin to access lower or zero tariffs?

options.label: Administrative costs of rules of origin outweigh the potential tariff saving
options.value: Administrative costs of rules of origin outweigh the potential tariff saving

options.label: Exports do not meet rules of origin requirements
options.value: Exports do not meet rules of origin requirements

options.label: Lack of understanding, staffing or expertise to use rules of origin
options.value: Lack of understanding, staffing or expertise to use rules of origin

options.label: My business has attempted to use rules of origin but has been unsuccessful
options.value: My business has attempted to use rules of origin but has been unsuccessful

options.label: The EU does not charge tariffs on the goods the business exports
options.value: The EU does not charge tariffs on the goods the business exports

values: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

blocks.title: Importing
blocks.description: This section asks for information about your business's importing activities and any related challenges.

questions.title: Which of the following statements best describes {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s importing status?
How did your business's importing in March 2022 compare with March 2021?
Did your business experience any of the following challenges with importing in March 2022?

options.label: Additional paperwork
options.description: For example, conformity assessments, customs declarations, health and rules-of-origin certifications

options.label: Change in transportation costs
options.description: For example, freight rates

options.label: Closure of infrastructure used to import goods or services
options.value: Closure of infrastructure used to import goods or services
options.description: For example, ports or shipping-container storage facilities

options.label: Customs duties or levies
options.description: Including VAT and other taxes

options.label: Destination countries changing their border restrictions
options.value: Destination countries changing their border restrictions

options.label: Finding information on how to import
options.value: Finding information on how to import

options.label: Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment
options.value: Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment
options.description: For example, containers, warehouse capacity or wooden palettes

options.label: Time taken for checks at the border
options.value: Time taken for checks at the border
options.description: For example, documentary or physical checks

options.label: Did not experience any challenges with importing in March 2022
options.value: Did not experience any challenges with importing in March 2022

values: Did not experience any challenges with importing in March 2022

questions.title: What was the main cause of these importing challenges?

options.label: End of the EU transition period
options.value: End of the EU transition period

options.label: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period
options.value: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period

blocks.title: Supply chains
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about:

  • any changes to supply chains
  • the availability of materials, goods and services within the EU
  • the availability of materials, goods and services within the UK
  • global supply chain disruption
  • the main concern to your business

questions.title: Has your business had any extra costs due to the end of the EU transition period?

options.label: Costs associated with changing supply chains
options.value: Costs associated with changing supply chains

options.label: Costs associated with the storage of goods
options.value: Costs associated with the storage of goods

options.label: Costs due to increased red tape
options.value: Costs due to increased red tape
options.description: For example, customs and rules of origin paperwork

options.label: Cost of setting up EU subsidiaries
options.value: Cost of setting up EU subsidiaries

options.label: Extra costs in the prices of goods and services imported
options.value: Extra costs in the prices of goods and services imported
options.description: Pre-tariff or pre-tax

questions.title: Was your business able to get the materials, goods or services it needed from the EU in March 2022?

options.label: Yes, the business was able to get the materials, goods or services it needed
options.value: Yes, the business was able to get the materials, goods or services it needed

options.label: Yes, but the business had to change suppliers or find alternative solutions
options.value: Yes, but the business had to change suppliers or find alternative solutions

options.label: No, the business was not able to get the materials, goods or services needed
options.value: No, the business was not able to get the materials, goods or services needed

questions.title: Does your business intend to open any new branches or subsidiaries in the EU in the next 12 months?

content.description: This refers to companies owned or controlled by another company, sometimes referred to as the parent or holding company.

questions.title: Was your business able to get the materials, goods or services it needed from within the UK in March 2022?

options.label: Yes, the business was able to get the materials, goods or services it needed
options.value: Yes, the business was able to get the materials, goods or services it needed

options.label: Yes, but the business had to change suppliers or find alternative solutions
options.value: Yes, but the business had to change suppliers or find alternative solutions

options.label: No, the business was not able to get the materials, goods or services needed
options.value: No, the business was not able to get the materials, goods or services needed

questions.title: How much disruption to your business have these challenges caused?
Did your business experience any global supply chain disruption in March 2022?

definitions.title: Examples of global supply chain disruption

questions.title: Please give more details about how your business has been affected by global supply chain disruption
Which of the following, if any, will be the main concern for your business in April 2022?

options.label: Competition
options.description: This refers to competition with other UK businesses

options.label: Inflation of goods and services prices
options.value: Inflation of goods and services prices

options.label: Introduction of full customs controls
options.description: From 1 January 2022, full customs controls apply for EU imports to GB

blocks.title: Prices
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about:

  • changes to energy prices
  • price rises experienced by your business

questions.title: Has your business been affected by recent increases in energy prices?

content.description: Include:

options.label: Yes, both production and suppliers have been affected
options.value: Yes, both production and suppliers have been affected

options.label: No, my business has not been affected
options.value: No, my business has not been affected

questions.title: In which of the following ways, if any, has your business been affected by price rises?

content.description: Include any price rises that your business has experienced

options.label: Had to absorb costs
options.description: For example, business took no action or used cash reserves

options.label: Had to pass on price increases to customers
options.value: Had to pass on price increases to customers

options.label: Had to reduce staff work hours
options.value: Had to reduce staff work hours

options.label: Unable to maintain workspaces
options.description: For example, due to rising energy costs

options.label: My business has not been affected by price rises
options.value: My business has not been affected by price rises

blocks.title: Sending goods to Northern Ireland
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about sending goods from GB to Northern Ireland and any related challenges.

Include

Goods sent to:

  • other businesses
  • other parts of your business
  • individual customers

GB means ‘Great Britain’ which includes England, Scotland and Wales, but excludes Northern Ireland.

questions.title: Has {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} sent goods from GB to Northern Ireland in the last 12 months?

content.description: Include
Goods sent from GB to Northern Ireland to:
This refers to ‘Great Britain’ which includes England, Scotland and Wales, but excludes Northern Ireland.

questions.title: In March 2022, how did the volume of goods your business sent from GB to Northern Ireland compare with February 2022?

options.label: Stopped sending goods to Northern Ireland
options.value: Stopped sending goods to Northern Ireland

questions.title: Please give more details about why the volume of goods sent from GB to Northern Ireland changed in March 2022

blocks.title: Operational Performance
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about your workforce such as:

  • working from home
  • safety measures
  • coronavirus (COVID-19) testing
  • worker shortages

questions.title: Is your business using, or intending to use, increased homeworking as a permanent business model going forward?
questions.description: If you are a sole trader and do not have a workforce, please base your answers on your own working arrangement.

questions.title: Why is your business using, or intending to use, increased homeworking as a permanent business model going forward?

options.label: Ability to better match jobs to skills
options.value: Ability to better match jobs to skills

options.label: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool in the UK
options.value: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool in the UK

options.label: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool internationally
options.value: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool internationally

options.label: Reduced carbon emissions
options.description: For example, due to less travelling to and from the workplace

values: Ability to better match jobs to skills
Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool in the UK
Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool internationally

questions.title: Why is your business not intending to use increased homeworking as a permanent business model going forward?

options.label: Concerns with integrating new starters into the workplace
options.value: Concerns with integrating new starters into the workplace

options.label: Costs of employee equipment
options.description: For example, the technology and equipment required to enable homeworking such as laptops or desks

options.label: Reduced reliability and retention of staff
options.value: Reduced reliability and retention of staff

questions.title: Is your business using, or intending to use, any of the following safety measures in the workplace?

options.label: Adjusted working practices
options.description: For example, staggered breaks, working in fixed teams and working shifts

options.label: Carbon dioxide monitors
options.description: To monitor ventilation or air quality to prevent the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)

options.label: Customer coronavirus (COVID-19) checks
options.description: For example, providing COVID-19 vaccine certification in Scotland, a NHS COVID pass in Wales or lateral flow test results

options.label: Hygiene measures
options.description: For example, increased cleaning of equipment and work areas

options.label: Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
options.description: For example, aprons, face masks and gloves

questions.title: Is your business providing regular coronavirus (COVID-19) testing for its workforce?

content.description: Include:
Exclude:

definitions.title: What we mean by 'regular coronavirus (COVID-19) testing'

content.description: This means that the business is testing the workforce on a routine basis to check for COVID cases, regardless of whether workers are asymptomatic. For example, testing once a week.

questions.title: What percentage of your workforce are receiving regular coronavirus (COVID-19) testing?

answers.label: Approximate percentage of your workforce receiving regular testing
Or select 'Not sure' if the percentage is unknown or is too difficult to calculate

questions.title: Is your business currently experiencing a shortage of workers?
How has the shortage of workers affected your business?

options.label: Had to pause trading of some of the business
options.value: Had to pause trading of some of the business

options.label: My business has not been affected
options.value: My business has not been affected

questions.title: Please tell us anything else about your business's current situation relating to topics covered in this survey

content.description: You have nearly finished! Make sure you continue to the next page and select submit answers at the bottom.

blocks.title: You are now ready to submit this survey

questions.title: Submission

list: You will not be able to access or change your answers on submitting the questionnaire
If you wish to review your answers please select the relevant completed sections
